questions.question:
Let R be a symmetric and transitive relation on a set A. Then

(GATE CSE 1995)
options:
A.

R is reflexive and hence an equivalence relation

B.

R is reflexive and hence a partial order

C.

R is reflexive and hence not an equivalence relation

questions.question:
Some group (G, o) is known to be abelian. Then, which one of the following is true for G?

(GATE CSE 1994)
options:
C.

\((goh)^2 = g^2oh^2 \text{ for every } g, h \in G\)
questions.correct_answer:
C.

\((goh)^2 = g^2oh^2 \text{ for every } g, h \in G\)

questions.question:
The less-than relation, \(\lt\), on reals is

(GATE CSE 1993)
options:
A.

a partial ordering since it is asymmetric and reflexive

B.

a partial ordering since it is antisymmetric and reflexive

C.

not a partial ordering because it is not asymmetric and not reflexive

D.

not a partial ordering because it is not antisymmetric and reflexive
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Let A be a finite set of size n. The number of elements in the power set of \(A\times A\) is:

(GATE CSE 1993)

questions.question:
Let S be an infinite set and \(S_1 \dots , S_n\) be sets such that \(S_1 \cup S_2 \cup \dots \cup S_n = S\). Then

(GATE CSE 1993)
options:
A.

at least one of the set \(S_i\) is a finite set

B.

not more than one of the set \(S_i\) can be finite

C.

at least one of the sets \(S_i\) is an infinite

D.

not more than one of the sets \(S_i\) can be infinite
questions.correct_answer:
C.

at least one of the sets \(S_i\) is an infinite
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider a simple connected graph G with n vertices and n edges (n > 2). Then, which of the following statements are true?

(GATE CSE 1993)
options:
B.

The graph obtained by removing any edge from G is not connected

D.

The graph obtained by removing any two edges from G is not connected
